content:
Posted: January 7
Just Cause it’s fun TL;DR Just cause 2 is a fantastic open world game with so much content to explore. Blow your way through Panau using enemies and objects as weapons. The grappling hook in this game is your best friend , it can be a great way to move around or a fun tool for attaching enemies to moving vehicles. With many secrets to find this game will have you playing for days. The only downside being is that the story is just thrown in and you wont remember it.Follow us here Steamship Discord: https://discord.gg/XbsKrtKSteamship Steam group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thesteamshipPros  Huge explorable mapsSatisfying explosionsHuge variety in vehiclesFilled with entertaining events Cons Very weak storyPoor quality cutscenes---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- GameplayWith just the grappling hook there are so many ways that you can cause chaos all over Panau. The game world is your playground with a near endless amount of destruction to be caused, there is no real punishment for attacking anyone but attacking the military is a better idea because the send reinforcements to be played with. Even though driving is slower than just grappling around all vehicles control so well and can be used in interesting ways to destroy the environment. StoryThe story is the weakest part of just cause because of how little it matters, While having some amusing references to real world politics. Characters The character in just cause are just stereotypical of certain culture and none of them seem to care about the destruction you bring with you. Every single time you interact with an npc to start a mission they basically always ask you to blow everything up till you win. Art/Graphics The massive map gives a plethora of beautiful environments, everything you can see on the map you can explore and there are many secrets to find. The world feels very natural as they mix purely natural areas and a few miles away there are military districts and towns. The games color pallet is never dull even in rain storms there are bright mixes of colors that look amazing.Bonus Notes The games DLCs are just things that max the game more silly and would agree getting them if they are in a bundle. Just cause 2 is one of the best open world games and will give hours of entertainment.If you like this join us here to get the latest Reviews:Steamship Discord: https://discord.gg/XbsKrtKSteamship Steam group : http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thesteamshipWhat would you like to see for our next review ? Ask in the comment section!

content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												There are a lot of improvements from his antecesor.The driving it's stable, but you still can't shoot your weapons from any vehicle while the others still can. It's true that the police it's able to shoot you from their cars because it's the passenger that does it. But the ones that drives the motorcycle doesn't have passengers and they still can shoot you while driving. But now you don't drive very often since you have a better way of transportation: Your grappling hook and parachute. They have created the best way to travel around the island. By just grappling something and opening your parachute you can go faster than a car and you don't need to worry about what is ahead of you. The only thing that is better than this it's just the helicopters and jets. The helicopters because you can attack your enemies more efficiently and the jets because you can travel the island faster. You can also climb with it and it makes running and walking very obsolete. It's like the whip in Super Castlevania IV. You can do everything with it and it makes everything more easy for you to do.The shooting system has been improved too. The ability of using 2 single handled weapons can make you clean an area very fast. Rocket launchers are useful now that you can have more ammo with it.Enemy helicopters are more forgiving now that they don't spam you with rockets every time you are on a vehicle. They are still a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ but it's a balanced pain.The missions are entertaining and if you fail it's because it was your fault, not theirs. But I hate that sometimes they tell you what you have to do after wandering in circles while everyone shoots you.The multiplayer mod it's just that. You and a bunch of players in one big island as a playground. Some servers let you join a team, play custom missions, or just be a free for all where you all fight in the rave club because why not.I recommend buying it with the Just Cause Collection. It comes with the DLC and the first Just Cause. So you can also experience how bad it's the prequel by itself and in comparison with this one.

												This is a game that will knock you're socks off, constantly. The graphics are breathtaking even in 2014 (arguably better than some other games currently out on the market.) The game play is good, consistant, although, the driving feels like the roads are ice instead of asphalt, the bikes are my favorite mode of transportation. This goes on sale, OFTEN. If you feel like you don't want to shell out 3 dosh for this, you are missing out on a great opportunity to experience to explore one of the more expansive and beautiful open world games in the early dawn of this century. For those of you just buying it for the multiplayer mod, thats fine too. It's a must to get that mod with it, but you would be just scratching the surface. The modding community for just cause 2 is expansive. i reccomend that you take some time to check out www.justcause2mods.com. The mods are free and so is sign up. The campaign isn't really anything to write home about, same blockbuster action with some cheap thrills mixed in there.If you are looking for an expansive open world game look no farther. Decent gameplay, amazing graphics and an all inclusive modding community make this one of the best games i have had the privileged experience of owning twice and spent countless hours on. Bottom line: ITS WORTH IT. GET IT!

content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												Just Cause 2 isn't your average Third-Person Shooter game, it's a completely unique twist.  This game is all about HOOKS, GUNS, DIVES and DESTRUCTION.+ Satisfying Action.+ Plenty of variety among vehicles; - A little less in guns though.+ Controls are easy to learn and use.+ Grappling hook mechanism is really fun to use and very well implemented.+ Even though the game was released in 2010, the Graphics are pretty darn good.+ The MAP is HUGE and takes a lot of time to explore. It has lots of scenery, moutains, water bodies, objects, building and much more.+ Game provides a lot of freedom, which is hard to find by in recent titles.+ Game has full 360 Controller Support, but I prefer KB/M because of the precision aim required to land hooks in extremely bizzare ways :)- Story sucks. (This was a huge turnoff for me atleast.)- Most of the missions are exactly the same damn thing again and again. You will do the exact same thing just at a different place with different clothed allies.- Unless you like to destroy everything, attach objects with hook for no-reason and do crazy♥♥♥♥♥♥. you'll get bored easily.- Game has some stability issues and crashed 3 times on my PC in 3 hours of gameplay. - The saving feature sucks, sometimes it over-writes your manual save with auto-saves. It auto-saves when you die, so the last checkpoint during a long mission is usually somewhere near the start of the mission.A lot of my friends just absolutely adored this game because of the freedom, flexibility it provides. The game will also tolerate any crazy♥♥♥♥♥♥you want to do and you will have an amazing blast if you are that kind of a person.  But for me, I look more in a game. I look for immersiveness and the ability of the game to keep me interested in it at all times.Final Thoughts:I got the game for about $3-4 and it was well worth the price.  I'm going to 'RECOMMEND' this game if you can get it within $7.5 which really ins't hard since the game is 4 years old and goes on sale pretty often.

This game has the second biggest game map ever created to date (I was told that FUEL has the biggest map which is 5,560 square miles)Just cause 2 map is 37 by 37 kilometers. A couple of kilometers on each side of the square map is water, so let's go by 35 by 35 kilometers. Multiply 35 by 35 and there you go - you have 1,225 square kilometers of map to explore, give or take 100 square kilometers.For the comparison, let's take the Fallout 3 map. That map is about 35 square kilometers.The Oblivion 4 map is roughly the same size.GTA 3 is 35-36 square kilometersGTA 4 is 15 square kilometersAnd I thought the Far Cry 2 map was huge. It's 50 square kilometers.The ARMA 2 map was definitely the biggest one before Just Cause 2 stepped in. The most important reason why i bought the disappointingly unoptimized ARMA 2 is to simply explore the roughly 400 square kilometers map.I remember wondering when I was younger if they would ever make a big enough map for a game which I could explore for days and days and days. I thought they finally did that with Arma 2, and despite the fact that I still could not play the game on maximum settings even when my rig should have easily taken on almost 2 ARMA 2's (According to the "recommended settings"), I still loved the fact that I could enjoy the country-side that I haven't been to in years.The second thing is that we ACTUALLY have directx 10 in this game. FINALLY, how many more directx 9 games are we going to have? We have directx 11 already, so what's the deal? The directx 10 pretty much seals the deal and completes the game map that I still cannot believe they made. I also cannot believe that the entire game fits on a DVD, how the HELL do they pull that off? shouldn't the map this size be at least 30 GB? I mean Age of Conan: Hyborian Adventure is like a 30-35 GB game.Well, the third thing is... Ah what the hell, you know the rest. Complete freedom of action, unrealistic stunts, the temporary to permanent abandonment of the laws of physics, infinite parachute, a hundred of drivable vehicles, a cute Easter egg, the Hatch from the first and second seasons of LOST, the pleasure of having to spend 20 minutes just to fly from one end of the map to another on a stolen government jet, the joy of swimming in the sea (wish they had sharks though), the eye candy explosions that you never get tired off, the realistic driving of the vehicles (aside from the way they rotate in mid air sometimes), the realistic damage to the PARTS OF THE VEHICLES THAT WERE ACTUALLY DAMAGED IN THE IMPACT, I could go on and on about this gameIm also playing this game on IMPOSSIBLE and find it quite easy to beat. You just move constantly, shoot (There is sadly a default auto-aim option enabled that you cannot disable) and press "tab" or whatever you have to evade bullets. HOWEVER, a nearby grenade explosion is almost guaranteed to kill you, so for MAXIMUM realism, I recommend playing this game on IMPOSSIBLEIm not gonna complain about the check point system, I love the checkpoint system. it makes games more challenging. Plus there still is a SAVE option, although it doesnt work in its original meaningThe story is blah. Who cares? Some of the missions that they give you though are somewhat original and a breath of fresh air from some of the repetitive GTA missions. However, most of those missions are, attack, kill, destroy, blow up, move on. It would have been nice if they added an element of stealth to the game though. It would feel great if could actually play as a somewhat silent or stealthy lethal saboteur. I would also like it if they imposed a penalty for killing civilians both on purpose and incidentally.I know this game won't win the game of the year award since there is no real substance I guess, but unofficially, this will probably be the gamer's choice No 1 game of 2010. (I hope Metro 2033 wins the game of the year though, which I rationally know it won't)This game is a pinnacle of guilty pleasure if I can say that. It absorbs so much of my time that I barely have enough time for myself, and its only my second-third day of playing the game. For the third day in the row I come to work late with blood-shot eyes. I actually prefer to staying home and playing this game all weekend and after that, instead of going out with my gf. That's how much impact this game had on me.If you are an extremely busy person with a busy schedule, i do not recommend playing this game until you find some time to kill, otherwise you'd get the plants vs zombies syndrome, where you cannot stop playing the game and start missing out on life. But I guess, now it's gonna be the Just cause 2 syndromeI don't want to get emo about this but I'll say honestly that it's actually games like these that make me sorta happy that I was born with enough luck and resources to actually play them, but I'm only speaking for myself here.Until then, the most rational case for you is to buy this game, support the developers and enjoy it fully until your eyes bleed and your brain melts, since forgetting about reality as much as possible should be the just cause of all gamers.

												Really good open world game with lots of destruction and an interesting gameplay mechanic that hooks you into the game. With the grapple hook and parachute you can go anywhere quickly and efficiently (No walking for minutes on end). The graphics are also quite nice and it runs well even if you don't have a gming PC (40 fps on high settings on my laptop). The setting of the game also differs from the usual city you usually see in open world games, and is a beautiful island with many settlements, mountains, military bases, and destructable objects. My only complaints with the game is that the isn't really a big enough variety of Cars and there is virtually no cunstomization for your character. Other than that its definetly a must buy at $15 and can easly provide over a hundred hours of gameplay (I played 30 hours and im only 40% done the game, even though I finished the story).

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Just Cause 2 is the single best open world action title released to date. There is no other game that allows you to do anywhere near as much as this game does, no other title gives you such an enormous sense of freedom and satisfaction. The game is visually stunning and contains some of the most exciting and beautiful moments I have ever witnessed whilst playing.The gameplay system gives players a variety of ways in which to move around their world and explore the beautiful tropical island of Panau, starting the player of immediately with a grappling hook-parachute combo that is a fantastic innovation by square enix. You are able to slingshot yourself using your grapple hook and parachute in unision, paraglide of the back of a boat, or -if you purchase the DLC- you can fly around using your parachute thrusters which are fantastic. The hook is fast and precise and very fun once you learn to use it effectively; it also allows you to 'Dual hook' objects and entities together for some entertaining results.The story isn't great and the voice acting is horrible, but I almost wonder whether this is the game poking fun at action movies that often suffer these tropes, however this dosn't detract from the experience much as the missions themselves are greatly varied and interesting.The DLC is reasonably priced and well worth shelling out a few dollars for as they add some great new weapons and wehicles. I particularly favour the parachute thrusters and the Air Gun that fires compressed air to blast enemies and vehicles high into the sky!If you like open world games then this is definitely one to look at, I have played for over 100 hours and I'm ready for the next  100 (: so go on, buy the game!

content:
Posted: July 31, 2013
												Just Cause 2 is an amazing sandbox game. After the first two cheesily bad missions, you're dropped right smack in the center of Panau, a small totalitarian country of islands, with few guns or grenades and all cities occupied by the government. As you gain in strength, upgrading weapons, vehicles, and your health, you become stronger.      As you work with 3 different criminal factions, the government loses territory. There are 3 factions: The Roaches, a mafia of sorts with a leader who speaks in medical terms; the Reapers, Panau's own branch of the Communist Party; and the Ular Boys, strong traditionalists opposed to all foreign customs.           There are vehicles galore (though too many Tuk-Tuks and motor scooters) and lots of collectibles and destructibles. Much of the world is empty, but when you steal a tank and go on an explosive rampage, you tend not to notice these things. Overall, worth the price whether it's on sale or not.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												  Just Cause 2 is an open world/sandbox action game that highly encourages Exploration. In this game you play as a man named "Rico Rodriguez" who is air dropped onto the fictional "Island of Panau" in order to find an Agency operative (the same Agency Rico is in) who has defected and gone rogue. You are freely allowed and encouraged to cause as much chaos and destruction on the fictional Island as possible, in order to spark a civilian resistance against the Island's ruthless Dictator, a man nick-named "Baby Panay".  In JC2, you earn "Chaos points" for causing Chaos (destroying buildings, killing enemies, sabotaging pipelines, assassinating military targets, or in general destroying anything that belongs to the Panuan government), which you can then use to unlock Main Story missions. Most of the Gameplay revolves around either exploring the Massive 400 Sq Mi island, doing missions, or in general causing chaos and/or destruction. You are given a small variety of weapons, including pistols, shotguns, assault rifles, machine guns and sniper rifles. You are also given a grappling hook that you can use to hook on to things, tether things together, or for use as a melee weapon.  The game has a faction system; there are three different factions you are allowed to join and become a member of. You can partake in Faction missions (which usually involve doing miscallenous tasks, such as hijacking a truck for example). The first Faction, named the "Ular Boys", have the eventual goal of turning Panau into an isolated nation, free of any and all government oppression/influence. The second Faction, named "The Reapers", believe Panau should be a controlled, communist nation. The third and final Faction, named "The Roaches", are a criminal syndicate and consequentially the most crime-oriented faction of the trio.  The game's graphics are very eye-catching and still hold up today. You can see the sun's light rays shine through the trees, every tire track on the highly detailed textures of the dirt roads, and every individual ripple in the very aesthetically-appealing water. With the game set to max, you wouldn't be able to guess this game was released in 2010. Gaming standards have really come a long way. Long gone are the days of "Half-Life" and "Rainbow Six", when the graphics were blocky and slightly unbelievable (but still great for their time). Game developers now focus on the graphical qualities/abilties of their video games, and it really pays off in the long run. However, I still believe the Gameplay aspect of any video game should be its primary focus, because thats where most of the heart and soul should go into.  Just Cause 2 is a very detailed and rich video game, that is not only very attractive, but also significant in the amount of general things to do. Some could argue that the game can get repetitive after the Main Story has been beaten and most of the Side Missions as well. This can hold true for some, however (even though I still have yet to beat the Main Story), I strongly believe this game can stil stay as fresh and vibrant as your first playthrough, solely due to the fact that the game is a giant, living Toybox just waiting for you to come and play. I find it immensely satsifying to use the grappling hook to board a plane mid-air, or tether an Enemy to the back of your car as you go for a ride, or even just in general exploring parts of the Island you either haven't seen before or haven't seen in a while (which will most likely be common, as the Map is really huge, it's hard not to miss things). In general, I highly recommend this game if you are a fan of Open-World Sandbox videogames.  My Final Rating: 8.5/10

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Just Cause 2 was a game I've looked into for a while, but never really thought about getting. Once it was sold for under $4 during a sale I had to give it a shot. This game was worth it, and I've sunk many hours into it quickly.Just Cause 2 really sticks next to it's name. Why? Just cause! Why else would you go into a millitary base, bombard it with a jet, dive bomb the plane into the raido tower and then drive a car off a cliff to give a horrific flash back when you rolled your car that one day.It really is a interesting experience, but the campains, either the main one or sides missions, are very repetative. The storyline is quite weak and is easily forgotten during the gameplay as you blow up more oil rigs.But the gameplay is what makes it worth purchasing. It's got an odd Grand Theft Auto: San Adreas feel to it. You know? The day you only have a half hour to kill beofre going to do something, so you load up the game to cause mass chaos and fear until you have to go. It's one of those games, and it does it quite well.Pros:Good gameplayDecent mechanicsNice graphics and aestheticMap size bigger than anything I've seen, even bigger than GTA VInteresting ways to use your grappling hookCons:Little money rewards and expensive weapons and vehiclesThe large map means that most places look the sameThe AI isn't very smartPlanes will explode when touching anything, even at speeds that you can out runMy rating 8/10, worth the purchase, at retail or sale price.

												Simply no reason not to have played this game if you have the hardware for it.  Outstanding visuals that are very well optimized.  Most of the missions in the game will leave you patting yourself on the back for being such a badass, and turn you into a condescending PC elitist when you see what your rig is capable of.  While there is a slight learning curve on the controls, halfway through the game youll be able to do things with precision unrivaled by many games.Some complaints:  I've found little use for land vehicles considering how many are available.  What I mean by this is that once you figure out the tricks of the parachute, you'll realize that with some skill, you can achieve a very respectable speed without the limitation of terrain.  Also some of the locations not attached to a mission feel copied and pasted, but are still fun to navigate, and possibly the cost of having such a large sandbox to play with your toys in.  More missions would've probably fixed this.  DLC?

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Quite simply the most fun I have ever had playing a computer game.  I originally tried the demo and that alone was so good that I was hooked to see what crazy things you can get Rico to do.  The demo was limited in area as to where you could go, so I had to have the full game.  As you can see I've played it quite a bit over the years.  The storyline isn't the best out there, but I don't think the developers had the story as their main priority when they were making it.  This game is all about the free to explore open world and Ricos grappling hook & parachute which you can deploy in various different ways.  I do have other FPS in my collection, which are considered good games, but I just keep on coming back to Just Cause 2, simply because It's just such fun!  I definetly think the tropical island paradise thing helps games like this, and This game will probably only be trumped in my eyes by Just Cause 3.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Just Cause 2 sports more style than substance.  But, that doesn't take away from the breathtaking open world of Panau.  Story wise is pretty much like the last game and is very forgettable, "Overthrow a corrupt Government by causing chaos in the region".  The main character "Rico" is a very generic action hero badass who is pretty much the equivilance of every 1980s action hero that creates the character.  I felt like the lack of character development and story is done on purpose because really, it's not all that important.  The reason however why most of the substance flaws are made up is because of how much effort Avalance Studious took their time to make the beautiful world as well as the masterfully executed gameplay mechanics this game has to offer including the infamous "grappling hook".  Overall, the story is not important but I recommend this game for the open world exploration, action, and many features of mass chaos.By the way if you don't already know, there is a bug that if you complete the full game of Just Cause 2, it will say 99.99%.  If this happens don't worry because this is only a minor bug and the developers are not supporting the game anymore because of Just Cause 3. Also, this game doesn't have mulitplayer, but there's a mod that someone created and is avalible on steam right now.

Be warned though, it does have its flaws - the story and characters are a joke (though I sense the developers use it ironically, and taken in that context, they work pretty well!), the AI is thicker than an obese cinder block house and there are some minor control issues.Dont expect anything mind-blowing and/or contemplative in the story/character department - they are as bad as it gets - instead, play it for what it was made for - silly, mindless fun.

												Really good open world game with lots of destruction and an interesting gameplay mechanic that hooks you into the game. With the grapple hook and parachute you can go anywhere quickly and efficiently (No walking for minutes on end). The setting of the game also differs from the usual city you usually see in open world games, and is a beautiful island with many settlements, mountains, military bases, and destructable objects. My only complaints with the game is that the isn't really a big enough variety of Cars and there is virtually no cunstomization for your character. Other than that its definetly a must buy at $15 and can easly provide over a hundred hours of gameplay (I played 30 hours and im only 40% done the game, even though I finished the story).

												Open world game, very repetitive but very fun. The world is massive and you job is to destroy anything that is destroyable. Gameplay is like GTA but with a hookshot and an infinite number of parashoots in one backback. Your grappling hook is centric to gameplay. You can use it with the parashoot to fly (glide with parashoot and grapple the ground far away to gain momentum), you can grapple objects together including vehicles, you can hijack planes by grappeling or you can simply use it to climb objects. Weapons, vehicles, and health can all be upgraded by destroying objects to get money and "chaos" or collecting various hidden items. When you get bored of that, look up the multiplayer mod. It allows servers to host games with several hundred people playing all at once!

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Just Cause 2 was a game I've looked into for a while, but never really thought about getting. Once it was sold for under $4 during a sale I had to give it a shot. This game was worth it, and I've sunk many hours into it quickly.Just Cause 2 really sticks next to it's name. Why? Just cause! Why else would you go into a millitary base, bombard it with a jet, dive bomb the plane into the raido tower and then drive a car off a cliff to give a horrific flash back when you rolled your car that one day.It really is a interesting experience, but the campains, either the main one or sides missions, are very repetative. The storyline is quite weak and is easily forgotten during the gameplay as you blow up more oil rigs.But the gameplay is what makes it worth purchasing. It's got an odd Grand Theft Auto: San Adreas feel to it. You know? The day you only have a half hour to kill beofre going to do something, so you load up the game to cause mass chaos and fear until you have to go. It's one of those games, and it does it quite well.Pros:Good gameplayDecent mechanicsNice graphics and aestheticMap size bigger than anything I've seen, even bigger than GTA VInteresting ways to use your grappling hookCons:Little money rewards and expensive weapons and vehiclesThe large map means that most places look the sameThe AI isn't very smartPlanes will explode when touching anything, even at speeds that you can out runMy rating 8/10, worth the purchase, at retail or sale price.

Posted: December 24, 2013
												This game is one of the best open world, shoot kill and steal (and blow up) anything games around. If you can stomach slaughtering thousands of southeast asian people essentially "because 'merica" then nothing should stop you from enjoying this.The main character is a combination of every action hero you can imagine, Spider Man(stanks to the magic grappling hook/human harpoon), and maybe a little bit of a 40K Space Marine. The morality is  greyblack, and civilians are fair game if you so desireas  slaughtering innocents only garners attention from the villainous military police force that supposedly cares nothing for the people of the nation. It's essentially GTA turned up to 11 and given a more militant vibe. The story is less amusing than the GTA series, though not totally dry. But seriously, who cares about story when you can be a violent terrorist and mass murderer?Also worth noting is the multiplayer mod, which strips many assets and all NPCs off the map and allows you to go on a killing spree against friends and well wishers. Just beware that the chat channels are essentially Anon centric as far as I've seen.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2012
												Just Cause 2 is obviously the sequel to Just Cause released in 2006. You're playing a skilled acrobatic operative named: Rico Rodriguez. I won't spoil the story, but his main objective is to cause mayhem on a fictional island Panau in Malay Archipelago of Southeast Asia. You can fly jets, drive cars, trucks, bikes and even disarm a rocket while it's in midair.Panau is not a monolithic island, there are deserts, cities and lush forests to explore by foot or vehicle. Just Cause 2 is powered by Avalanche Engine 2.0 that simply makes brings Panau paradise feeling into life.Peace.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2013
Personal rating: 9/10Bought on: Discount (75%)DLC: Questionable. Adds a bunch of new toys to play with, but besides the Air Gun it's nothing you can't find and do the same. The DLC equipment if fairly powerful, but just as expensive.Before we start...Do you smirk when you cause a big explosion? Do you smile when you cause a soldier to die in a most creative way? Do you enjoy hijacking cars at high speed?Then welcome to Just Cause 2, where you can do this and much more.Just Chaos(e)Just Cause 2 has a unique way to make you proceed in the story line: by causing immeasurable amounts of chaos and wreck havoc in Panau, the country where the game takes place. That's right, where in games you want to avoid doing this because you don't want the pesky military on your back, here the game says: "Here, have some guns and go blow stuff around! We'll even pay you for this!"Causing chaos is the only way to open new Story Missions and Black Market items, so in short, you must do it.To do your job you are given tools like Pistols, Grenades, Grenade Launchers, Rocket Launchers, Shotguns and Machine Guns, you know, the usual. But then you have a Tuk-tuk with a cannon, and the DLC offers you a godd*mn Monster Truck with Grenade Launcher and Machine Gun attached to it.Why stick to the ground anyway? You can also destroy stuff by using battle helicopters or even jet fighters if you have the skill to use them.GameplayJust Cause 2 is fantastic, the controls are mostly responsive and rarely fails or does something you didn't mean to, at least when playing on ground, where about 90% of the game takes place.However there are some problems here: sprinting barely increases Rico's speed and you'll almost always look for at least a car to travel around, and sport cars (the fastest of the game) are nigh impossible to control with the keyboard. Using jet fighters to cause destruction is also difficult since it goes VERY fast, if you are intending to do a precision shot, then forget it.Hook, grapple, killOne of the most interesting features in this game is Rico's grappling hook. That thing allows you to do all sort of crazy stunts, the ones that would put make Hollywood's cheesiest movies to go sulk in a corner, full of envy. Did you miss that car you wanted to hijack? Grapple on is and take it!Is a soldier in a vantage point thinking he's safe? Make your grappling hook introduce him to lady gravity.Is a soldier in a mounted gun pestering you? Pull him for a closer combat.Is a military chopper on your case? Grapple on it and take the chopper for you, then kill everything on land.You can even tether one thing to another, like a soldier to a car for example. Or a soldier to a lamp post. Or a soldier to the helicopter and take him for a "ride".Panauan landscapesTired of wandering in jungles or tropical scenery? Don't worry, Panau has an immense diversity of all kinds of terrains for you to explore: snowy mountains, deserts and cities which all have many places to go and cause more destruction.Missions and challengesIf you grow tired of pointless destruction there are always missions which gives you directions to cause more, destruction and help you speed up the story line. Racing challenges are also available to test your driving skills, however most of them can be quite difficult thanks to the finicky car/plane controls.

There are TONS of collectibles and give you either money, higher max health, weapon parts (used for upgrading weapons), vehicle parts (used for upgrading vehicles), or armor parts (which give you a tiny amont of health). Posted: February 1, 2012
												Simply no reason not to have played this game if you have the hardware for it.  Outstanding visuals that are very well optimized.  Most of the missions in the game will leave you patting yourself on the back for being such a badass, and turn you into a condescending PC elitist when you see what your rig is capable of.  While there is a slight learning curve on the controls, halfway through the game youll be able to do things with precision unrivaled by many games.Some complaints:  I've found little use for land vehicles considering how many are available.  What I mean by this is that once you figure out the tricks of the parachute, you'll realize that with some skill, you can achieve a very respectable speed without the limitation of terrain.  Also some of the locations not attached to a mission feel copied and pasted, but are still fun to navigate, and possibly the cost of having such a large sandbox to play with your toys in.  More missions would've probably fixed this.  DLC?

												If you're looking for a good story and great plot, this is not the place to look. However, if you want an over the top action game with little things making sense and an enormous world with great graphics, buy Just Cause 2. This game is very vehicle driven - if you want to hijack a plane in mid air you can. If you want to have dogfights with jets this is your game. TL:DR: GTA without a plot meets metal slug.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Just cause 2 is a Free-roaming Hookshot-em-up that takes the very idea of a freeroamer, builds a game out from that idea, and then multiplies it by a factor of 10^100. It is absolutely brilliant. But if I had to describe the game in 3 words, it would have to be Fun, Amazing and Silly. And anyone who has played a freeroamer knows that a silly game is great. Face up, it seems like your standard freeroamer based around side missions with a main story mixed in. But once you start digging, you never want to stop. The game has 3 main ideas that the game is buildt upon. Number one: The black market. The black maket is like a vehicle store, a gun shop and a transport system all in one. Here you can buy ammo, if you run out and you're not in a mission, where ammo is free, but you can also buy some vehicles for a bigger price. These are generally one time use only, when you want a fast car, or when an airport is not close enough. It also features a transport system, where it transports you to wherever toy've been before, for free. "Gimmick" number two: The grappling hook. Oh boy, is this thing fun. It seems like your normal grappling hook, only useful to get you from point A to point B, but this thing is so much more useful. Yes, it can just get you from A to B if thats what you want, but it can also drag you to vehicles, such as Helicopters and Cars that are usually really hard to hijack when they are moving, plus that it has the ability to drag people too you, if that is an enemy or just a random NPC that you met on the street. "Gimmick" number three: Chaos. Instead of your usual points system, Just Cause 2 features a Chaos system, that you get my doing missions, destroying enemy property, blowing stuff up, or getting Heat. Heat is a system that shows how agressive the military is against you. If it is at 0, then they wont attack you. At max however, they want you dead at all costs. Instead of a 5 star meter like in GTA, it is a bar, that progressively fills, so you exactly know how much they're after you. When your Chaos meter eventually drops to 0, you get some chaos and some money. Chaos unlocks missions, items in the blakc market, but most importantly, it unlocks story missions. Which is important, since it encourages you to jerk around and have a blast, which is what this game does best. With an absolutely HUGE map, breathtaking visuals, great vehicles and stunning gameplay, this is a game worth buying. At only 15€, it's definately worth picking up. I give Just Cause 2 a 10/10.

												Stupid fun. Goes extremely cheap during the steam sales and at that point you 100% should buy it.The story and voice acting isn't the best, but if anything that just adds to the enjoyment to the game. It perfectly compliments the silly fun you can have in this game.The police are crazy and it is really fun to try and survive for as long as possible while being attacked by the police. You can also exploit their AI and make them drive off bridges, which is both hilarious and a good way to get rid of them.The game is beautiful and still lives up to todays standards, without needing a beefy computer to run it. (Just don't look at the leaves on the trees when you go past them).You get given a grapple hook (that can also attatch two objects together), infinite parachutes, and 400 square miles to play with. You can have hours of fun just messing about with attatching cars, planes, and people together.Mods are incredible in this game, and can make the game loads more fun if you are willing to install them (although it does take away from playing the story missions).

												This game is one of the best open world, shoot kill and steal (and blow up) anything games around. If you can stomach slaughtering thousands of southeast asian people essentially "because 'merica" then nothing should stop you from enjoying this.The main character is a combination of every action hero you can imagine, Spider Man(stanks to the magic grappling hook/human harpoon), and maybe a little bit of a 40K Space Marine. The morality is  greyblack, and civilians are fair game if you so desireas  slaughtering innocents only garners attention from the villainous military police force that supposedly cares nothing for the people of the nation. It's essentially GTA turned up to 11 and given a more militant vibe. The story is less amusing than the GTA series, though not totally dry. But seriously, who cares about story when you can be a violent terrorist and mass murderer?Also worth noting is the multiplayer mod, which strips many assets and all NPCs off the map and allows you to go on a killing spree against friends and well wishers. Just beware that the chat channels are essentially Anon centric as far as I've seen.

												What can you say about this action filled, mass destroying, awesome rocking, derping game? - It rocks.Ok, You're a guy and the goal is to create chaos on a HUGE map.You can run, walk and even swim if you to get somewhere!Or if you're lazy, just step out from the shadows  and take a car / plane / boat or whatever you will find.You also has a parachute and a grappling hook.With the grappling hook you can connect two things with each other, drag something to you, hit someone with it or just do the fun stuff like connecting a human to a plane and see him fly awaaaaaaaaaaaaaay.Ok.Pros: - A great and fun game- Alot to blow up and destory- Many places to see-Great environment.Cons: - This game only works with Windows Vista / 7 and the graphic card must support Directx 10- No multiplayer feature (But I can understand that, kind of)- Kinda Easy4.0 BOINKS... sorry for my spelling and grammar mistakes but it's 05.30 am here...Good Night

Posted: December 1, 2013
												Just Cause 2 is one of my favorite games of all time.  The gunplay and methods of movement (vehicle, running, jumping, rolling, hang gliding, and the AMAZING way in which your near-superpower of a grappling hook) are wonderful.The grappling hook is also a fun weapon that you can tie things to each other or things to the ground.  The world is beautiful and massive.The community is writing a multiplayer mod which will only make a great game better.I challenge you to respond with a better value on Steam than Just Cause 2.Update: 9/5/2015 I just fired this up on my stream and I'm enjoying it so much I'm going to do a full lets playthrough.  I strongly recommend that you purchase this title (at least when it goes on sale) it should be in your Steam library.

												Probably one of the best open world games out there.  When Just Cause 1 came out, it was fun, but deep down a gta clone that took place in a jungle with a few unique features.  Just Cause 2 then made a total name for itself.  From the insane grapple mechanics to the incredible map size, Just Cause 2 became a house hold name.  And this game goes on sale for less than a Starbucks coffee all the time, so the price for value is astounding.  I recommend this to literally everyone who likes fun.

Posted: June 27, 2014
												This game is reccomended for anyone that loves to blow sh*t up. Just Cause 2 is a beautiful game and has such precise weapons and vehicles to get the job DONE! The voice acting is simply remarkable and the graphics of the game is just breath taking! The glitches have hilarious outcomes and in Just Cause 2, you can make your dreams of defying gravity, come true! The grappeling hook has been attached to Rico's arm so you can shoot your gun and grappel onto people and surfaces (at the same time.) You can now do something called "dual hooking." Dual Hooking is where you take your grappeling hook and tether one thing to another, so I can take a Titus ZJ (a sports car) and tether that to a Pandak "Baby" Panay statue (statue of Panau's current dictator) and drive off in the Titus ZJ and the statue that I tetherd would fall down. Anyways, like I saud, I would reccomend this game to anyone that loves to play video games and to anyone that loves to blow sh*t up.Infinite / 10.
